meanings.definition: To perceive or experience emotions or sensations
meanings.sent1: She feels happy when she sees her friends.
meanings.sent2: He feels sad when he watches sad movies.
meanings.sent3: The puppy feels excited when it sees a ball.
meanings.sent4: His heart feels heavy with sorrow.
meanings.sent5: The warm sun feels like a hug on her skin.

meanings.definition: To have a strong emotional response
meanings.sent1: The child feels scared of the dark.
meanings.sent2: The audience feels excited before the concert starts.
meanings.sent3: He feels nervous before giving a speech.
meanings.sent4: Her words feel like a warm embrace to him.
meanings.sent5: The victory feels like a burst of joy in his heart.

meanings.definition: To touch or handle something in order to perceive its quality or texture
meanings.sent1: She feels the softness of the blanket before buying it.
meanings.sent2: He feels the rough texture of the rock in his hand.
meanings.sent3: The chef feels the freshness of the vegetables before cooking.
meanings.sent4: The fabric feels like silk against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The sand feels gritty under his feet at the beach.
